  • Element
arez.annotations

Annotation Type Repository


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface Repository
    Annotation that indicates that a repository must be generated for component. A repository is the default mechanism for managing instances of classes annotated with ArezComponent. The repository provides mechanisms to create a component, lookup a component by id or using a query and dispose the instance. These activities can be done by the user through other means but the repositories provide an easy solution.

    This annotation can only be added to classes that have been annotated with the ArezComponent annotation.

    Annotating a class with this annotation will result in a class named "[MyComponent]Repository"

    The way to add custom queries or Memoize queries is to define an interface that defines an abstract self() that returns the underlying repository. Using this combined with default methods, you can define as many new queries and mutations as is desired. The extension class then needs to be registered by setting the appropriate parameter on this annotation.

    An example of what an extension may look like for a Issue component. See below:

    
 public interface MyIssueRepositoryExtension
 {
   default Issue findByTitle( final String title )
   {
     return self().findByQuery( issue -> issue.getTitle().equals( title ) );
   }

   \@Memoize
   default List<Issue> findAllCompleted()
   {
     return self().findAllByQuery( Issue::isCompleted );
   }

   MyIssueRepository self();
 }

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Repository.AttachType attach
      Indicate the strategy for attaching entities to the repository.
      Feature dagger
      Indicate whether a dagger module should be generated for repository.
      Repository.DetachType detach
      Indicate the strategy for detaching entities from the repository.
      Class<?>[] extensions
      Return the list of extension interfaces that the repository will implement.
      InjectMode inject
      Specify how the repository is integrated into the injection framework.

    • Element Detail

      • extensions

        public abstract Class<?>[] extensions
        Return the list of extension interfaces that the repository will implement. The extension interfaces should not define any non-default methods besides self().
        Returns:
        the list of extension interfaces that the repository will implement.
        Default:
        {}

      • dagger

        public abstract Feature dagger
        Indicate whether a dagger module should be generated for repository. Feature.ENABLE will force the generation of the module, Feature.DISABLE will result in no dagger module and Feature.AUTODETECT will add a dagger module if the dagger.Module class is present on the classpath.
        Returns:
        enum controlling whether a dagger module should be generated for repository.
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Feature.AUTODETECT

      • inject

        public abstract InjectMode inject
        Specify how the repository is integrated into the injection framework.
        Returns:
        enum controlling the integration of the repository into the injection framework.
        See Also:
        InjectMode
        Default:
        arez.annotations.InjectMode.AUTODETECT

      • attach

        public abstract Repository.AttachType attach
        Indicate the strategy for attaching entities to the repository.
        Returns:
        the strategy for attaching entities to the repository.
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Repository.AttachType.CREATE_ONLY

      • detach

        public abstract Repository.DetachType detach
        Indicate the strategy for detaching entities from the repository.
        Returns:
        the strategy for detaching entities from the repository.
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Repository.DetachType.DESTROY_ONLY
